intro: Agrostophyllum asahanense, commonly known as the Asahan grass-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, sturdy stem. Agrostophyllum asahanense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
